ext_descriptions.ext_description: A Routed_interconnect_component is a type of . The functionality of a Routed_interconnect_component shall be that of a short.
the routed_centreline_shape specifies the role of the for the Routed_interconnect_component.

ext_description.p: A Component_feature_external_reference is an unambiguous reference to a in a different design.
ext_description.example: Items in an design view may need to reference component features in a reference assembly in order to unambiguously identify source of layout requirements.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: the name specifies the role of a string for the Component_feature_external_reference.
the associated_component specifies the role for a for the Component_feature_external_reference.

ext_description.p: A Component_external_reference is an unambiguous reference to a in a different design.
ext_description.example: Items in an design view may need to reference component to assembly relationships in the assembly in order to unambiguously identify source of layout requirements.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: the reference_designation text for the Component_external_reference. The reference_designation uniquely identifies the externally referenced component in the reference assembly.

the product_definition_id specifies text for the Component_external_reference. The product_definition_id identifies the original for the assembly. If not available in the originating system, the string "UNKNOWN" shall be provided.

ext_description.p: the revision_code specifies text for the Component_external_reference. The revision_code identifies the version of the reference assembly.
ext_description.note: Usually the revision_code and part number identify the original assembly for which an interconnect is designed.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: the part_number specifies text for the Component_external_reference. The part_number identifies the reference assembly in the context of the design_owner.

the design_owner specifies text for the Component_external_reference. The design_owner is the organization that maintains the registration document for the part_number for the reference assembly. Usually it is the design authority.
A Bare_die_component is a type of that is defined by a .
the derived_from specifies the role of the for the Bare_die_component.
A Packaged_component is a type of . A Packaged_component may be a . A Packaged_component is an instantiation of a at a given location within the context of a printed circuit assembly.

the access_mechanism is an inverse relationship that specifies that the existence of the Packaged_component is dependent on the existence of the that specifies the Packaged_component as its . There shall be one or more for a Packaged_component.
the selected_package_alternate specifies the role of the for the Packaged_component. The selected_package_alternate need not be specified for a particular Packaged_component.
the derived_from specifies the role of the for the Packaged_component.

A Bare_die_component_terminal is a type of that is an instance of a . The Bare_die_component_terminal is the area on the bare die instance onto which an enterprise will place bond wires, joining the active areas on the die instance to the next level of assembly. It is not necessarily the shape of the land itself on the die.
the associated_component specifies the to which the Bare_die_component_terminal provides electrical access.
the definition specifies the role of the for the Bare_die_component_terminal.
A Minimally_defined_component_terminal is a type of that is included to permit references to terminals without including geometric representations of the terminals.
the definition specifies the role of the for the Minimally_defined_component_terminal.

ext_description.p: An Assembly_module is a type of . An Assembly_module may be a , or may be a . An Assembly_module is an assembly view of a product. An Assembly_module is also a design view of a product. This application object supports design reuse, modular product definitions, component libraries, and related technologies. There may be discipline views that further specialize this view.
ext_description.example: Figure is an illustration of an Assembly_module.
ext_description.note: An Assembly_module could be a ball grid array design, an MCM design, a disk drive design, a line card or plug-in module in a telecommunications rack, or a line replaceable unit in an airframe or spacecraft. Incomplete designs that have some specified functionality as defined by a functional definition may be included in a component library application, for example. The designs may be included in an active design by reference. At the appropriate time in the design phase, the single reference is replaced with individual references to the elements that compose the Assembly_module. Support is provided for maintaining the information necessary to trace back to the original Assembly_module from the released through the .

categories other than Pca, such as MCM-L (Multichip Module, Laminated), MCM-D (Multichip Module, Deposited) and MCM-C (Multichip Module, Ceramic) may be included through the use of this application object, and population of the and application objects.
The use of for this purpose is deprecated, since the view of a product does not usually specify technology. Future editions of this standard may not support a technology attribute of .

ext_description.p: A Component_mounting_clearance_relationship is the relationship between the features of one component and another in their next assembly, with respect to the clearance between them.
ext_description.note: This clearance is required when a specific component requires a minimum distance from the printed circuit board or another specific component.

This clearance is often derived from the mechanism requirements of the factory equipment that assembles the components to their next assembly. The mechanical handling fingers that grasp and place a component require clearance from previously placed components in order to place the second component and release it from the mechanism.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: the maximum_mounting_clearance specifies the , of the maximum distance between the current_component and the previously_placed_component, for the Component_mounting_clearance_relationship. The maximum_mounting_clearance need not be specified for a particular Component_mounting_clearance_relationship. The value shall be interpreted as the specification to be satisfied by the assembly process.

the minimum_mounting_clearance specifies the , of the minimum distance between the current_component and the previously_placed_component, for the Component_mounting_clearance_relationship. The value shall be interpreted as the specification to be satisfied by the assembly process.
the current_component specifies the of the features of the components to be placed for the Component_mounting_clearance_relationship.
A Component_mounting_feature is a type of .
the definition inherited from the shall be redeclared as for the Component_mounting_feature.

A Component_overlap_relationship is the relationship between one component and another in their next assembly, with respect to the physical overlap between them. This overlap is often derived from the mechanism requirements of the factory equipment that assembles the components to their next assembly. The sequence of assembly is established by the previously_placed_component and the current_component, in turn, and the minimum clearance between the two components is taken into consideration during assembly.

the maximum_added_clearance specifies the of the maximum distance between the current_component and the previously_placed_component for the Component_overlap_relationship. The maximum_added_clearance need not be specified for a particular Component_overlap_relationship.
the minimum_added_clearance specifies the of the minimum distance between the current_component and the previously_placed_component for the Component_overlap_relationship.
the current_component specifies the , of the component to be placed next, for the Component_overlap_relationship.
the previously_placed_component specifies the , of the component previously placed for the Component_overlap_relationship.

A Movable_packaged_component_join_terminal is a type of . A Movable_packaged_component_join_terminal is one termination for a . The terminal provides access to the electrical functionality of the movable_packaged part being terminated.
the minimum_wire_terminal_length specifies the minimum dimension of the of the Movable_packaged_component_join_terminal.
the maximum_wire_terminal_length specifies the maximum dimension of the of the Movable_packaged_component_join_terminal.

A Package_terminal_occurrence is an occurrence of a in a for the case where the equivalent is not populated. This application object is provided to specify the cases where no is defined for a because there is no access to functionality specified through that . There is a requirement to support the fact that the connects the realized terminal of the component to the realized terminal of an or to other members of .
the associated_component specifies the role of the for the Package_terminal_occurrence.
the definition specifies the role of the that has no defined electrical functionality for the Package_terminal_occurrence.

ext_description.p: A Packaged_component_join_terminal is a type of . A Packaged_component_join_terminal may be a . A Packaged_component_join_terminal is one termination for a . The terminal provides access to the electrical functionality of the packaged part being terminated.
ext_description.example: Figure illustrates a detail of a assembly drawing that shows a microcircuit plugged into a socket, and the role of the Packaged_component_join_terminal.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: the associated_component specifies the being accessed by the Packaged_component_join_terminal.
the definition specifies the role of the for the Packaged_component_join_terminal.

ext_description.p: A Pca is a type of . A Pca describes a printed circuit assembly. A printed circuit assembly is nearly a synonym for printed wiring assembly, except that a printed circuit assembly may include printed components in its printed circuit board and a printed wiring assembly is constructed upon a printed wiring board that is totally interconnect without printed components. Another synonym for printed circuit assembly is circuit card assembly.
ext_description.example: See figure for an illustration of a Pca.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: the usage_view specifies the , as seen from the context of its next assembly, for the Pca.

ext_description.note: The text description for this Application Object has not been fully updated to agree with the EXPRESS.
ext_description.p: A Routed_physical_component is a whose design shape is design specific and is routed along a path described by a centreline.
